thread.title: The Wayne Rooney To China Rumour Just Got Real
thread.title_full: The Wayne Rooney To China Rumour Just Got Real

title: The Wayne Rooney To China Rumour Just Got Real
text:
The Wayne Rooney To China Rumour Just Got Real Wed Feb 22 2017 00:45:10 GMT+0000 (GMT) Wed Feb 22 2017 00:45:10 GMT+0000 (GMT) Jack Kenmare Jack Kenmare in football 
Never has this rumour been so heavily speculation - Wayne Rooney's record breaking move to the Chinese Super League has been sanctioned by Manchester United, according to The Mirror. 
In his press conference before Manchester United's trip to Saint Etienne tonight, when asked if Wayne Rooney will be fit for Sunday's final, Mourinho insisted that he doesn't want Rooney to leave the club but said he "cannot guarantee" he'll be at Manchester United at end of the season. 
He also said that he would never push a legend like Wayne Rooney out of Manchester United, but says "you'll have to ask Rooney" if he's staying. Now, a number of publications have came to the conclusion that Rooney will leave the club in the coming days. 
The Mirror have gone with a the back page splash 'Goodbye Rooney Tuesday', because the Chinese Super League closes on, you guessed it, Tuesday. 
The above states that Rooney will become the world's best player, with a weekly salary in the region of Â£750,000-a-week being thrown around. 
While The Telegraph report that Wayne Rooney's record breaking move will depend on whether he plays in the EFL final on Sunday. Wayne Rooney's move to the Chinese Super League could hinge on whether he's picked for the #EFLCupFinal https://t.co/ltn4tTcfO8 - Telegraph Football (@TeleFootball) February 21, 2017 
The Mirror's 'insider' states: "Nothing could happen until Wayne beat Sir Bobby's United goal-scoring record. We all knew that once he'd beaten that, the time would come to review his career here." 
"Everything remains totally amicable. We are well aware of what Wayne has done for the club and he appreciates the career he's had here. 
"But sometimes it's best for all the parties concerned to look at where we stand and plan a way forward that works for everyone." 
Should Wayne Rooney move to the riches of China, or should he remain at Old Trafford? 
Let us know your thoughts. Sponsored Links
